creator: gyorksprint@earthlink.net
text:
I'm new to Log4j (which is excellent) so bear with me if this is off, but...

The standard use of Category.getInstance() seems to be to use the class object 
or classname as the argument.  This means people write lots of:
public class foo{
    private static Category log = Category.getInstance(foo.class);
....

usually by copy and paste from another class.  Often they (I) forget to change 
the class name in the process.  Perhaps this is just personal sloppiness or 
laziness, but I would really find it helpful if there was a method which just 
knew the class to use in looking up the category by pulling it off of the stack 
trace.  Something like:

public class foo{
    private static Category log = Category.getInstanceForThisClass();
....

Thanks for your time,
George York

creator: ceki@apache.org
text: I am aware of the issue. We will add such a feature if we can.
